newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish bond prices rise in slack trade.
newsitem.headline: Danish bond prices rise in slack trade.

text.p: Danish bond prices rose on Wednesday, in quiet trade ahead of the Ascension Day holiday.
"It will be a day without great interest. The benchmark will most probably trade between 110.20 and 110.50," a dealer said.
At 0900 GMT the benchmark eight percent state bond due 2006 was up 0.13 point from Tuesday's close, to 110.45, yielding 6.41 percent.
Its June future rose 0.26 point to 110.14.
The 10-year yield gap with Germany narrowed to 64 basis points, from Tuesday's 66 bp and the crown firmed to 3.8080 per mark from 3.8103.
